testcase: Guidance on cross version breaking change for readonly and async operations in new api-versions
query:
title: Guidance on cross version breaking change for readonly and async operations in new api-versions

question: Hello team,
We have introduced new api-version to enhance the feature to support more functionalities in Microsoft.Edge\Configurations resource-type.
https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr/pull/25302
Existing model has just one readonly field - provisioningState till now in all existing api-versions - 2024-09-01-preview, 2025-06-01 and 2025-08-01.
```
"resource":{
"properties":{},
"tags":{
"key64":"wwupf"
},
"location": "west us"
}
```
As part of new business requirements, we are enhancing the feature to support more fields (optional) with LRO implementation.
Now, with this new proposed change, PR is flagged with cross-version breaking-change.
1.Since we've added additional optional fields in resource-type, new model has been created in generated swagger called ConfigurationPropertiesUpdate for patch operation. The ProvisioningState being readonly field, it is obviously not added as part of ConfigurationPropertiesUpdate - that is considered as breaking change as field removal. To our understanding, it is wrongly flagged as breaking change for readonly field renamed/removed for patch operation. Please correct our understanding in case.
```
The new version is missing a property found in the old version. Was 'provisioningState' renamed or removed?
New: [configurations/preview/2025-12-01-preview/configurations.json#L3295:7](https://github.com/patelkunal/azure-rest-api-specs-pr/blob/0af8181bd0735d27df24ea3a6f373680d59119a4/specification/edge/resource-manager/Microsoft.Edge/configurations/preview/2025-12-01-preview/configurations.json#L3295:7)
`definitions.ConfigurationPropertiesUpdate.properties`
Old: configurations/stable/2025-08-01/configurations.json#L1337:7(https://github.com/Azure/azure-rest-api-specs-pr/blob/main/specification/edge/resource-manager/Microsoft.Edge/configurations/stable/2025-08-01/configurations.json#L1337:7)
```
2.We've changed CUD operations as LRO as we are bringing up MRG with this api-version as part of new business requirements. Although, it is based on customer input where customer selects if they want this then we will provision MRG via LRO operation. Otherwise, it is instantaneous sync response (200 status code). Given that these operations are exposed via LRO, those changes are included in the new api-versions. What should be the right approach to implement this requirement without having to introduce breaking change?
Thanks in advance.
ground_truth:
The 'provisioningState' change in the PATCH request model seems like a bug fix if this field was always read-only.  When you get a breaking change review, if this is explained with an appropriate comment, this is likely to be justified as a bug fix.
On changing PATCH to synchronous.  ARM does support async PATCH operations, although REST API Guidelines discourage async PATCH operations.  If this operation is synchronous in the previous stable version, then this change is a real breaking change that you will need to justify in breaking change review.
Similarly, making PUT and DELETE Asynchronous is a breaking change if these operations were synchronous in the previous stable version is a real breaking change, and you will need to justify the change in a breaking change review.
